comment.author: 66406516@N08
comment._content: Held in reserve at Bull Run (Manassas), this regiment was discharged on July 31, 1861.

comment.author: 78573794@N07
comment._content:
cwsurgeons
The 4th NJ Militia was at Arlington Heights, VA in July, 1861 (not 1863).  The persons in the photo are, seated (L to R) , Dr Alvin Satterthwait of Mount Holly NJ, Colonel Matthew Miller of Camden NJ, unknown.  Standing L-R, unknown, Major Robert C. Johnson of Salem NJ, Dr. Elijah Woolston of Marlton, unknown, unknown, unknown and Adj. William B. Hatch of Camden. This is the only time that the two surgeons were in the same place at the same time.  At the end of the 3 month enlistment, Dr. Satterthwait joined the 6th NJ Volunteers and then the 15th NJ.  Dr. Woolston returned to private practice but served as a contract surgeon in 1864 when the US Gov opened a military hospital at Beverly NJ. 
 .
